What are the prerequisites for running a Hedera Mirror Node with Google Cloud Storage?

The prerequisites for running a Hedera Mirror Node with Google Cloud Storage include having a Google Cloud Platform account, basic understanding of Hedera Mirror Nodes, Docker (>= v20.10.x) installed and opened on your machine, and having Java, Gradle, and PostgreSQL installed.

How can I obtain Google Cloud Platform Requester Pay Information?

To obtain Google Cloud Platform Requester Pay Information, you need to generate your Google Cloud Platform HMAC access keys by creating a new project, linking your billing account, navigating to Cloud Storage > Settings, accessing the Interoperability tab, and creating access keys for your account.

What is the purpose of the application.yml file in the configuration process for the Hedera Mirror Node?
The application.yml file is the main configuration file for the Hedera Mirror Node. It is used to update the GCP keys and specify the Hedera Network to be mirrored.

How can I start my Hedera Mirror Node using Docker?
You can start your Hedera Mirror Node using Docker by running the command 'docker compose up -d db && docker logs hedera-mirror-node-db-1 --follow' from the 'hedera-mirror-node' directory.

How can I access the data collected by my Hedera Mirror Node?

To access the data collected by your Hedera Mirror Node, you can access the PostgreSQL database used by the mirror node by entering the 'hedera-mirror-node-db-1' container and running commands to view the database tables.

What is the final step after successfully running and deploying a Hedera Mirror Node with GCS?
The final step after successfully running and deploying a Hedera Mirror Node with GCS is to stop and remove the created containers by running the command 'docker compose down'.
